boat.name: Vilma
boat.full_description:
'Vilma' was built in 1934 at Vejle on the Baltic coast of Denmark for the newly opened port of Hvide Sande on the North Sea coast.

She was registered at Ringkobing as RI 100 and fished mainly for sole selling to the home market. She was sold from this port in 1979 to a Mr William Rarity of Sunderlans who used her for trawling. In 1987 she was sold to John Watson of Maryport where she was used for trawling, mussel and cockle dredging.

Retired out of fishing in 1996, she was bought by Scott Metcalfe who converted her over four years to a topsail schooner. Based in North Wales and registered MCA cat 2 to carry 12 persons, she takes part in many Irish Sea events as well as Brest and Douarnenez Festivals.
boat.short_description: 'Vilma' was built as a fishing boat on the Baltic coast of Denmark in 1934.
